resources:
//INFO How to use ADHDaily What\'s the difference between the three lists? The app includes three different lists:\n\nTASKS: This is where you can include any pending to do that has no specific date or time. We recommend writing down any task that could be done at different times in the future, but that must not forget. \n\nEvery TASK can be marked as PRIORITY to push said task to the top of the list. They can also be converted into GOALS by clicking the task and pressing the CONVERT button\n\nGOALS: We suggest that you use this list to add every to do you need to get done before a specific date, or to keep track of the steps of a project.\n\nEVENTS: Events are activities with a set date and time. We advice you to use this for activities or occurrences outside of your routine. What do the colors on the dates mean? GOALS, as well as EVENTS, include dates on screen. These can be shown in different colors to convey certain information.\n\nRED: Dates while be displayed in red when they have expired, meaning the date set has passed. You can reassign it by clicking the item and selecting a new date.\n\nYELLOW: This color will display when the date set matches the current date, implying that the selected day has come.\n\nGREEN: Dates will be in green color when they have been completed before the set limit date. Good job! For every other case, dates will be displayed in black.\n\nColors have said meanings only when referring to dates, while the color you choose for the tasks titles can mean whatever you want! Go back
ADHDaily Agenda
Title Description Date Add Update
Add task Add task Update task Add goal Add event
Tasks Goals Events Convert task into goal Mark as priority null null
Empty list! Goals are to do\'s you want to complete before a specific date, and that you will probably not attempt to complete in a single sitting. They can be a single task, multiple of them or even be the steps of a project. \n\nExample: Read a book. Tasks are to do\'s without a determined schedule or that can be completed at various times. You can write down anything you want to remember, and can also convert them into goals later on. \n\nExample: Buy more coffee. Events are activities that take place in a specific date and time. Write down everything that\'s not routine. \n\nExample: Appointment with the doctor.
